meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The catalogic book displayed all the items neatly.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the catalogic approach to organizing her closet.
meanings.sent3: The catalogic arrangement of the toys made the room look tidy.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked in a catalogic manner, neatly categorizing everything.
meanings.sent5: The catalogic system made it easy to find the desired item quickly.

meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the organization of information in a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The catalogic software helped in sorting the data efficiently.
meanings.sent2: He followed a catalogic method to arrange the files on his computer.
meanings.sent3: The catalogic way he listed his excuses was both amusing and organized.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were catalogic, each idea neatly filed away.
meanings.sent5: The catalogic approach simplified the search for specific details.

meanings.definition: A system or method of organizing information in a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The library used a catalogic to keep track of all the books.
meanings.sent2: She consulted the catalogic to find the location of the document.
meanings.sent3: The catalogic was so detailed, it even listed the color of each item.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a catalogic, storing information in an orderly fashion.
meanings.sent5: The catalogic made it easy to locate any item in the collection.
